questions.text: A shade of what is called 'Feuille Morte' (dead leaf) in French?
What was the color of early margarine before the color dot was worked through it?
questions.explanation:
White.

	Originally called oleomargarine it was developed in 1869 in France and introduced to the U.S in 1874.

Yellow.

	An evergreen shrub or small tree native to northern India.

questions.text: What song contains the lyrics 'falls over sleepy garden walls'?
What was the color of the steed ridden by a knight in shining armor in traditional folklore?

questions.explanation:
Yellow.

	A flowering plant most abundant in the north temperate zone.

questions.text: What appears to be the color of the water in a 9 foot deep swimming pool if the bottom of the pool is painted white?
What color was the rain that fell on Hiroshima for two hours after the atomic bomb was dropped?
What color does the heraldic term 'gules' denote?
Ecru is a shade of brown.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Actually a light-yellowish brown or tan.
